Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown ribbed pottery vessel, the interior is light-brown in colour and spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, exterior covered with a brown-coloured slip and faint traces of at least nine lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing an invoice.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.149)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87668) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87668)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 188 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
